intro: Krombholzia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf krombholzia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for coastal gardens. The fruit, which is edible, has a mildly sweet and aromatic flavor.
